page.title: 07OUNDLE PUBLIC SCHOOL 3
page.content: Although the majority of the school population is only in Oundle during term-time, the school has an impact on the town throughout the year. It provides work usually of a domestic and secretarial nature for local residents. Older pupils from Prince William School, the local comprehensive, sometimes 'moon-light' as waitresses and kitchen-staff in the evenings and early mornings. The town also benefits from some of the school's facilities like the bookshop, and also the swimming-pool and theatre which are not in our block! It is true to say that without the school Oundle would be a very different town, particularly at lesson change times when schoolboys are moving from one part of the town to another because the teaching areas are scattered all over the place!
